measured_by: Revised Green et al. Paranoid Thoughts Scale (R-GPTS)
justification: The Methods section states, "We collected the Revised Green et al. Paranoia Thoughts Scale (R-GPTS)", indicating that paranoia was assessed with the R-GPTS scale.
The article notes, "We collected the ... Self-Report Psychopathy - Short Form (SRP-SF)", showing that psychopathic traits were measured with the SRP-SF instrument.
The questionnaire list includes "Short Dark Triad (SD3) machiavellianism scale", linking Machiavellianism to the SD3 Machiavellianism subscale.
The same sentence lists the "SD3 ... narcissism subscales", indicating narcissism was assessed with the SD3 narcissism subscale.
The Methods specify collection of "the Personality Assessment Inventory-Borderline Scale (PAI-BOR)", showing BPD traits were measured with the PAI-BOR.

measured_by: Percentage of trials with consistent C1 and C2 classifications but conflicting advice in the perceptual advice task
justification: Under Behavioral metrics: "Deception was quantified by measuring the number of trials in which a participant had consistent classifications (C1 = C2) but gave advice that conflicted with their own classification ... Deception scores ranged between 0 ... to 100".

measured_by: β parameter of the Fehr-Schmidt utility model
justification: The Computational modeling section explains "β is the guilt parameter" and later compares "guilt (β) values" between groups, treating β as the quantitative measure of guilt.

measured_by: η / γ ratio parameter from the computational model
justification: The model description states "The ratio of these two parameters, η/γ, can be interpreted as representing the participant's belief about how susceptible their partner is to the advice", indicating η/γ operationalises perceived vulnerability.
